tuv.seg: Employee share option schemes
Scéimeanna Scaireanna Fostaithe in Éirinn
In Ireland, employees can avail of certain share options from their company that may be 'tax free' or 'tax efficient'
In Éirinn, is féidir le fostaithe roghanna faoi leith scaireanna a ghlacadh óna gcomhlacht a d'fhéadfadh a bheith "saor ó cháin" nó "cáin éifeachtúil"
However, it is useful to bear in mind that there are few benefits employees can receive that are completely 'tax free'
Ach, de bharr athruithe sa reachtaíocht in Éirinn is féidir le fostaithe leas a baint as rath a gcomhlacht gan dliteanais mhóra cánacha titim orthu
There are two main ways an employee can benefit from shares in the company:
Tá dhá phríomh bhealach gur féidir le fostaí leas a bhaint as scaireanna sa chomhlacht:
• Approved Profit Sharing Schemes
• Scéimeanna Ceadaithe le Brabús a Roinnt
Approved Profit Sharing Schemes
Scéimeanna Ceadaithe le Brabús a Roinnt
Approved Profit Sharing Schemes allow an employer to give an employee shares in the company up to a maximum value of €12,700 per year tax-free
Tugann Scéimeanna Ceadaithe le Brabús a Roinnt deis don fhostóir scaireanna sa chomhlacht a thabhairt don fhostaí suas go dtí uasluach de 12,700 euro sa bhliain saor ó cháin
Approved Profit Sharing Schemes are subject to certain conditions set out in legislation and administered by the Revenue Commissioners
Tá coinníollacha faoi leith ag baint le Scéimeanna Ceadaithe le Brabús a Roinnt atá leagtha síos i reachtaíocht agus atá dhá riaradh ag na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim
Providing the scheme meets the required conditions, an employee will pay no tax on shares up to a maximum value of €12,700 per year
Má shásaíonn an scéim na coinníollacha, ní íocfaidh fostaí aon cháin ar scaireanna suas go dtí uasluach de 12,700 euro sa bhliain
The employer must hold the shares for a period of time (called the "retention period") and the employee must not dispose of the shares before three years

Ní mór don fhostóir na scaireanna a choinneáil ar feadh tréimhse ama (ar a dtugtar an "tréimhse choinneála") agus ní féidir leis an bhfostaí fáil réidh leis na scaireanna sula mbíonn trí bliana caithe
If an employee disposes of shares before this time, he or she is liable to pay income tax on whichever is the lower of the following:
Má fhaigheann fostaí réidh leis na scaireanna roimhe sin, beidh air/uirthi cáin ioncaim a íoc ar pé acu is lú eatarthu seo a leanas:
• The market value of the shares when they were given to the employee or,
• Luach margaidh na scaireanna nuair a tugadh don fhostaí iad, nó,
• The value of the shares at the time of sale
• Luach na scaireanna ag am an díolacháin
Approved Profit Sharing Schemes are subject to a number of conditions that should be checked with the Revenue Commissioners
Tá roinnt coinníollacha a bhaineann le Scéimeanna Ceadaithe le Brabús a Roinnt agus ba cheart iad a chinntiú leis na Coimisinéirí Ioncaim
More information can be found in Revenue's publication Approved Profit Sharing Schemes IT62 (pdf)
Is féidir tuilleadh a léamh anseo maidir le Scéimeanna Ceadaithe le Brabús a Roinnt (pdf)
Revenue approved Savings-related Share Option Schemes allow you to save for and purchase share options in your employer's company tax effectively
Gearrtar an Cháin ar Ghnóthacháin Chaipitiúla ar an difríocht idir an bpraghas ceannaithe agus an praghas a dhíoltar na scaireanna air ina dhiaidh sin
You should check with the Revenue Commissioners and your employer as to what rules apply to your share options and when you are liable to pay tax
Tá cáin iníochta ar gach díbhinn a éiríonn as scéimeanna le brabús a roinnt agus scéimeanna roghanna scaireanna
You can find information in Revenue's publication A Guide to Savings-Related Share Option Schemes (pdf) and in Revenue's eBrief No
Tá sé tábhachtach déanamh cinnte leis na Coimisinéirí ioncaim agus le do fhostóir cé na rialacha a bhaineann le do roghanna scaireanna agus cén uair a mbeidh cáin le n-íoc agat, má bhíonn
